setLayer(int) - Method in class component.Component
Sets the layer of this component
setNeighbor(Tile, int) - Method in class component.Tile
Sets a neighbor of this tile using Tile.RIGHT, Tile.LEFT, Tile.TOP, or Tile.BOTTOM
setState(State) - Static method in class state.State
Sets the current State to be the given State
settingsButton - Static variable in class assets.Assets
The settings button
SettingsButton() - Constructor for class assets.Assets.SettingsButton
 
settingsButton - Variable in class state.MenuState
The settings button
settingsState - Static variable in class model.Game
The State for the settings screen
SettingsState - Class in state
A State which handles the game settings
SettingsState(Canvas) - Constructor for class state.SettingsState
 
sheet - Variable in class view.SpriteSheet
The image the textures are contained within (png preferred)
SpriteSheet - Class in view
A class representing a group of textures, each occupying a fixed width and height
SpriteSheet(int, int, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class view.SpriteSheet
Constructs the SpriteSheet with the given width, height and image
start() - Method in class model.Game
Start running the game
startButton - Variable in class state.MenuState
The start button
startGameButton - Static variable in class assets.Assets
The start game button
StartGameButton() - Constructor for class assets.Assets.StartGameButton
 
state - package state
 
State - Class in state
A section of the game responsible for loading and managing assets as well as displaying them to the screen Analogous to a screen (menu screen, settings screen, game screen, etc.)
State(Canvas) - Constructor for class state.State
Constructs a new State with the given Canvas
stickiness - Variable in class component.Tile
How many tiles this one can hold in place to prevent falling
stop() - Method in class model.Game
Stop running the game
strength - Variable in class component.Tile
How many tiles can be above this one before it collapses and turns into an item -1 if the tile cannot collapse
